channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 15-17 Penge high street / crampton road, 15th September
item.description:
Today there were several dirty nappies and a potty left on the pavement. Apart from this being absolutely disgusting for local residents, I think the council needs to conduct a welfare check on this HMO. Residents have been complaining for months about this property (leaving waste all over the door step and pavement) and seemingly nothing is being done. What has to happen for you to intervene here?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Crampton Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge, two bags of rubbish including wood and a door, 15th September
item.description:
I am unsure of which house it comes from, but this happens quite frequently. This time there is a fridge freezer, a bag full of what looks like insulation, another bag with planks of wood and a whole door. This alleyway is near a school and especially with the wind and rain at the moment it is becoming dangerous to users of the alleyway. It is at the top of the alleyway closest to hillsgrove close, welling. The fridge and door have been there for about a week, maybe two but the bags of rubbish are new so about 3/4 days

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hillsgrove Close, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag slipped down over no left turn sign, 15th September
item.description:
One of the flags has wrapped itself the no left turn sign by Welling library. Most people know Churchfield Avenue is a one way street, but people who are not local will not see this sign

item.title: Vehicles driving , parking and left on walkways, 15th September
item.description:
Since the flats have been lived in and still being built , cars are driving on the walkway and leaving the cars there. this is putting children and adults at risk as this is also the entrance to the recreation ground. they are there day and night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Road, New Barnet, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned for several months and untaxed, 15th September
item.description:
This car has been stranded here for around 5 months and has not moved. It is untaxed. The car is parked in a free parking zone such that no other vehicles can park infront of it so it is preventing other residents and members of the public from accessing 2 free parking spaces instead of one

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Granville Road, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Walkway granville road, 15th September
item.description:
Drug addicts building tents in the Granville Road walkway. Making walking through the walkway both in the day and night very very dangerous. There are also drug businesses going on there.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Neo-fascist graffiti on the crosswalks, 15th September
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Victoria Park Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Builder completely blocking the pavement, 15th September
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lavers Road, Hackney, London
